task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 123°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full building in view (including roofline and ground reference) before estimating height, so I will tilt up to capture the top.
The view is now pointing north and upward, so I must rotate back to the target direction (about 123°) while keeping some upward pitch to see the roofline.
To estimate height reliably I need to see both the building base and roof in the same frame, so I'll tilt up slightly while staying on the target heading.
The heading has reset to north again, so I need to rotate to 123° while keeping the upward pitch to capture the building top.
Since the view keeps snapping back to pitch 0, I'll stop rotating and instead move laterally to get a clearer, less obstructed view for height estimation.
I’m now facing southwest, so I should rotate left to roughly 125° to re-acquire the target building direction before estimating its height.
To face the target at ~123° from a current heading of 270°, I should rotate right by about 213° to align with the building.
A preset rotation will align me exactly to 123° (the target building direction), so I’ll rotate left to that heading.
The rotations have not aligned as expected, so I will directly rotate to an absolute heading of 123° to face the target building.
Using the provided 'Look LEFT' option will set the heading to 123° exactly, aligning me with the building to estimate its height.
I need to face 123° from 270°, which is a left rotation of 147° (or right 213°), so I’ll rotate left 147° to align to the target.
The interface indicates that rotating left from 213° will bring me to 123°, so I will execute that to face the building.
Rotations seem to be mis-applied, so I'll choose a move (front-left) to change position and then reattempt aligning to the building for a height estimate.
I should rotate left to about 125° (the provided option) to face the target building direction and then estimate its height.
Given the heading keeps reverting, I will provide an estimate based on the visible multi-story facade proportions typical of a ~4–5 story building (~3.5 m per story).
